result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy Joe Snyder

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Billy Joe Snyder, appeared with Attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Attorney Daniel Steffen appeared for the State. Plq filed. Atty Biller resites agreement, Def. to plead to counts 1 & 2 in case 2015CF43, cases 15CF45 and 16CF5 are dismissed outright, all others are DRI. PSI to be ordered The State provides reasons  for reaching this agreement. In Count 1 in 2015CF45 the State moves to amend to misd. theft 943.20 and dismissed, the restitution of $1,000 to be read in, amount stip to.  The Court examines Def. re the PLQ, witness ID's, it is his signature on it. Constitutional rights being waived are spelled out. Def. agrees.  Being convicted of a FE explained to Def. He understands the elements of the 2 charges he is pleading to. Def. has no questions. The Court explains read in charges. The Court explains the difference between a withheld sentence as opposed to an imposed/stayed. No threats or promises made to him to plead today. He has had enough time to talk w/his attorney about the pleadins. Def. enters pleas of G to counts 1 & 2. Pleas entered FKV and I. understands  the nature and understanding of the penalties of the 2 charges. The Court finds him G. No longer can use or possess a fire arm. 15CF45 as amended, read in for restitution and dismissed outright as is 16CF5. All TR's and FO are dismissed. and all other CM's, CF's, and CT are DRI.

Defendant Billy Joe Snyder in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Defendant in custody.  William Lund Norine appeared for State of Wisconsin. 17 cases called, 3 cases scheduled for PH. Atty Biller addresses the Court waiving the PH's. and requests bond modification. The State waives time limits for the bond mod. The Court examines Def. re: waivers of PH. Def. understands the purpose of the PH's, he wishes to give up his rights to the PH's, he has had sufficient time w/his Atty to waive PH's, no threats or promises made.  The Charges of each of the cases are reviewed w/the Def. The Court finds the waivers entered KFV, in 15CF43, 15CF45, and 16CF5. Info's filed in 15CF43, 15CF45 and 16CF5, they mirror the criminal complaints. in 15CF43, 15CF45 and 16CF5 Argn's held.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.    Acknowledge receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas entered to all counts. Atty Biller explains Def. was serving sentence in MN. Rule 25 assessment done by Loretta Hansen, he is available in 4 different facilities. Def. able to post $1,000.  The State responds, he needs to be transfered to the facility (inpatient and return directly to the Jail) Atty Biller readdresses the Court, can provide a seamless transition.  The Court denies bond modification. Speedy Trial demand entered. October 25, Motions filed with/in 30 days  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 25, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 11:00 AM Defendant Billy Joe Snyder in court, in custody.  William Norine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court fully, completely examines Def. reguarding an attorney. The DA addresses the Court stating how is would be helpful to have an attorney for a possible global resolution. The Defendant is willing to wait another week. Def. requests bail modification or furlough. The State responds, possible furlough for inpatient treatment. The Court denies modification at this time.

Bond to cover all open misdemeanor and felony cases: 13CM284, 14CF84, 14CF149, 14CM4, 14CT78, 15CF43, 15CF45, 15CM44, 16CF5
Must appear at all court hearings. Must provide written notice to Clerk of Court's office within 48 hours with change in mailing, physical address or phone number; No contact with Big Mike's, Nicole Chute or Delayne Barnes; Must maintain absolute sobriety; No use or possession of illegal drugs or alcohol, substances or paraphernalia without a valid prescription; Must submit to drug testing by law enforcment with reasonable suspicion.

Defendant, Billy Joe Snyder, appeared.  Atty. William Lund Norine appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin. All cases called. All warrants are quashed. Atty Murtaugh has withdrawn. Court advises ways to get attorney. Defendant states he has been in contact with PD's office and one will be appointed. Atty Norine: if he follows his grid, he would be asking $10,000 cash. One bond to cover all open cases. Does have local ties to community. Defendant states that he did call to try to reschedule court hearing that he missed due to issues with treatment. Wishes to get back to treatment. Court orders one bond to cover all open misdemeanor and felony cases. $7,500.00 cash bond due to history. Prelim set in 15CF43, 15CF45 and 16CF05. Status for all other cases to track along.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2018 at 11:00 am.
